page.title: 18PAST CHARACTERS
page.content:
Robert Cocks of Notting Hill, in the time of Thomas Fulcher (who was vicar for 64 years), gave the school house and the alms houses on the edge of the green to the village. There is a plaque in the school house which says:
"Glory to God - Mr Robert Cocks of Notting Hill, London, in presenting his generous gift to the parish of Old Buckenham of this schoolroom....thus expressed himself:-
It is my desire and prayer that this school house shall be for all time a nursery where children may be taught on Protestant principles their duty to God and man.
Deed of Gift - December 21st 1883"
